collection.description: This collection of Northwestern University football films dates between 1929 and 1984 with a gap for the period 1932â€“1934. The films record actual intercollegiate games although for many seasons not all contests are represented. The films are most complete for football seasons from the 1950s through the 1980s; beginning in the late 1950s, practice, junior varsity, and freshman team game films often are included. Northwestern team and Big Ten Conference football highlight films are scattered across the collection from the 1930s through the 1970s.
collection.title: Athletic Department Football Films

The films are most complete for football seasons from the 1950s through the 1980s; beginning in the late 1950s, practice, junior varsity, and freshman team game films often are included. Northwestern team and Big Ten Conference football highlight films are scattered across the collection from the 1930s through the 1970s.

description.item: Final score, NU: 31, Northern Illinois: 6. Coach: Dennis Green. This game was NU's first win after 34 consecutive losses, and snapped the longest losing streak in Division I football. It also marks the second occasion where fans pulled down the goal posts to deposit in Lake Michigan ("laked the posts").

description.item: Scenes from four different football games. The first game is the freshmen football team versus an unknown opponent. The next films are of spring football practice games. Spring football includes practices, drills, and â€“ to close the spring practice season -- an intra-varsity game and, sometimes, a varsity versus freshman team game. The first spring practice game is played on the practice field adjacent to Dyche Stadium. The final two spring games are played inside Dyche Stadium. Coach: Ara Parseghian.
